result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Quinn Brzezinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Should defendant get revoked, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.

Seek and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Jodi N.
No restitution request made; therefore, Court set restitution at zero.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.
Urine screens.
Parenting counseling.
Child visitation allowed only by third party to comply with Family Court and this Court's order regarding visitation.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work; good time allowed. Court STAYED report date to : 5/9/14 by 5:00pm. Court would have no objection to transfer of condition time or the probation time to Antigo, county of Langlade, Wisconsin.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Quinn Brzezinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Justice Point pretrial report received and filed. rn

Defendant Derek Quinn Brzezinski in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State brought to the attention of the Court a possible violation of the No Contact Order.  Arguments heard.  Court again reiterated conditions to the defendant regarding the parameters of allowable visitation with the child they have in joint custody.  Court ordered defense counsel and his client to come up with a Plan A, Plan B, and Plan C to arrange child drop-off as previously ordered by Family Court.  Defendant is to have NO CONTACT whatsoever with the victim.  If defendant still needs assistance, he should contact the police.  Court denied State's motion to increase bail at this time, but WARNED defendant that failure to comply with all court orders would result in an increase in bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered matter continued before Branch 20 on 4/29/14 at 1:30 p.m.
State's Motion to Increase Bail, received and filed. rn

Defendant Derek Quinn Brzezinski in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail addressed as to No Contact Order involving victim, Ms. Jodi N.  Court reiterated conditions of No Contact Order on file that he is to have absolutely no contact whatsoever with the victim.  He may have his allotted visitation with his child as ordered by Family Court.  Defendant's mother (Jasmine A.) is the allocated third-party to arrange visitation between the two.  All other conditions of bail continue.

Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; just received an offer.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jodi N

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Defense requests bail be addressed on the next date as to the No Contact Order.

Defendant Derek Quinn Brzezinski in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Derek Quinn Brzezinski in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Current: 514 Watson Street, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 03-12-2014)
Prior: 3628 West 6 1/2 Mile Road, Caledonia, WI 53108
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
